result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:55 AM Defendant James M Byrd in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for James M Byrd.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State has complied with victim's rights. 
Cases called for Jury Status in 21CM1779 and 22CF154. A third case was recently filed. 
Parties have reached a global resolution.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date with enough time to allow Defendant to complete prerequisites to accept global offer. 
The jury trial is removed from the calendar.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Witness List.
Jury status hearing on September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Trial Order signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow 06/16/2022.

Jury status hearing on September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.  **Rescheduled due to conflict with the Court's calendar.**
Jury trial - 12 person on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:01 AM Defendant James M Byrd in court with attorney Angela Wang.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases called to address warrants issued for non-appearance at the last hearing. 
Defense requests that the Court quashes the warrants and reinstates bond.
The State has no objection.
Court quashes the warrants and reinstates the bonds.
Court sets both cases for trial. 
State to file Motion for Joinder within 10 days if they intend to. 
Court will issue a trial scheduling order. 
  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Branch 2 Only
Ext. Code: 3

10:33 AM Attorney Angela Wang in court.   Defendant James M Byrd did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincheloe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney advises the Defendant is on his way.
As long as Defendant checks in with the court prior to 10:45 AM, a capias will not issue.
New charges may be filed. 
10:50AM Defendant has not appeared. 
Court issues a Branch 2 Only Capias and Revokes and Forfeits bond in both cases. 
The next hearing is removed from the calendar.
Hearing on June 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:35 AM Defendant James M Byrd in court with attorney Angela Wang.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Alyssa Jay, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for status.
Defense has received some additional discovery. 
State requests some time to review with the Defendant.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on April 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:43 AM Defendant James M Byrd in court with attorney Angela Wang.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of amended complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
